intro: Erythrostictus europaeus, commonly known as the European erythrostigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruit. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often in racemes, and bloom in the spring. The species is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh conditions.
